poem:
### The Ribbon of Land

A corridor of conflict,  
a sliver of sand and stone,  
nine miles of whispers,  
a breath between borders.

From sea salt kisses  
to checkpoints at dawn—  
a demilitarised dream,  
where history won't sleep.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "What is the Philadelphi corridor, and why is it so important to Israel? What is the Philadelphi corridor? The Philadelphi corridor is a ribbon of land about nine miles (14km)s in length and 100 metres wide along Gaza’s border with Egypt, including the Rafah crossing.It was designated as a demilitarised border zone after the withdrawal of Israeli settlements and troops from Gaza in 2005 and runs from the Mediterranean to the Kerem Shalom crossing with". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
